modules.simulator.hdc package¶

Submodules¶

modules.simulator.hdc.model module¶

This module provides the agenda-based user model for the handcrafted simulator.

class Agenda[source]¶

Bases: object

A stack-like object representing an agenda. Actions can be pushed on and popped off the agenda.

clean(goal: utils.goal.Goal)[source]¶

Cleans the agenda, i.e. makes sure that actions are consistent with goal and in the correct order.

Parameters

goal – The goal which is needed to determine the consistent actions.

clear()[source]¶

Empties the agenda.

contains_action_of_type(act_type: utils.useract.UserActionType, consider_dontcare=True)[source]¶

Checks whether agenda contains actions of a specific type.

Parameters

  • act_type – The action type (intent) for which the agenda will be checked.

  • consider_dontcare – If set to True also considers actions for which the value is ‘dontcare’, and ignores them otherwise.

Returns

True if agenda contains act_type, False otherwise.

Return type

bool

fill_with_constraints(goal)[source]¶

Adds all inform actions to the agenda necessary to fulfill the goal. Generally there is no need to add all constraints from the goal to the agenda apart from the initialisation.

Parameters

  • goal – The current goal of the (simulated) user for which actions will be pushed to the

  • agenda. –

fill_with_requests(goal, exclude_name=True)[source]¶

Adds all request actions to the agenda necessary to fulfill the goal.

Parameters

  • goal – The current goal of the (simulated) user for which actions will be pushed to the agenda.

  • exclude_name – If True, an action requesting for the name is omitted and included otherwise.

get_actions(num_actions)[source]¶

Retrieves num_actions actions from the agenda.

Parameters

num_actions – Amount of actions which will be retrieved from the agenda.

Returns

list of num_actions user actions.

Return type

List[UserAct]

get_actions_of_type(act_type=<enum 'UserActionType'>, consider_dontcare=True)[source]¶

Get actions of a specific type from the agenda.

Parameters

  • act_type – The action type (intent) for which the agenda will be checked.

  • consider_dontcare – If set to True also considers actions for which the value is ‘dontcare’, and ignores them otherwise.

Returns

A list of user actions of the given type/intent.

Return type

Iterable[UserAct]

init(goal)[source]¶

Initializes the agenda given a goal. For this purpose, inform actions for constraints in the goal and request actions for requests in the goal are added such that the informs are handled first followed by the requests.

Parameters

goal (Goal) – The goal for which the agenda will be initialized.

is_empty()[source]¶

Checks whether the agenda is empty.

Returns

True if agenda is empty, False otherwise.

Return type

bool

push(item)[source]¶

Pushes item onto the agenda.

Parameters

item – The goal for which the agenda will be initialized.

remove_actions(act_type: utils.useract.UserActionType, slot: str, value: str = None)[source]¶

Removes actions of a specific type, slot and optionally value from the agenda. All arguments (value only if given) have to match in conjunction.

Parameters

  • act_type – The action type (intent) which will be removed from the agenda.

  • slot – The action type (intent) which will be removed from the agenda.

  • value – The action type (intent) which will be removed from the agenda.

remove_actions_of_type(act_type: utils.useract.UserActionType)[source]¶

Removes actions of a specific type from the agenda.

Parameters

act_type – The action type (intent) which will be removed from the agenda.

class HandcraftedUserSimulator(domain: utils.domain.domain.Domain, logger: utils.logger.DiasysLogger = <DiasysLogger adviser (NOTSET)>)[source]¶

Bases: modules.simulator.simulator.UserSimulator

The class for a handcrafted (agenda-based) user simulator.

Parameters

  • domain (Domain) – The domain for which the user simulator will be instantiated. It will use

  • domain to generate the goals. (this) –

receive(sys_act)[source]¶

This function makes sure that the agenda reflects all changes needed for the received system action.

respond()[source]¶

Gets n actions from the agenda, where n is drawn depending on the agenda or a pdf.

start_dialog(**kwargs)[source]¶

Resets the user model at the beginning of a dialog, e.g. draws a new goal and populates the agenda according to the goal.

Module contents¶

This package contains the handcrafted user simulatod and related modules.
